case.title: CJ-FF-PRD-2026-02 — Phishing → Credential Harvesting Attempt
case.description:
### Narrative
FinanceFront HR receives multiple reports of a "Payroll Portal Update" email sent to employees. The sender impersonates HR and uses a look-alike domain to harvest Microsoft 365 credentials. Shortly after an employee opens the attachment, we see outbound HTTP traffic to the phish domain and a follow-on LOLBAS execution chain.

### What you must prove
1) Who received and interacted with the message (user/host)  
2) Whether the attachment led to execution (process chain evidence)  
3) Whether the phish infrastructure was contacted (DNS/HTTP evidence)  
4) What containment steps are required and what evidence supports them

### ATT&CK mapping
- TA0001 / T1566.001 — Spearphishing Attachment  
- TA0002 / T1204.002 — User Execution: Malicious File  
- TA0005 / T1218.005 — Mshta (proxy execution)  
- TA0002 / T1059.001 — PowerShell (encoded)

tasks.title: Triage the reported email (header, sender, subject, attachment)
tasks.description: Capture sender, subject, attachment name/hash, and who reported it.

tasks.title: Pivot to Zeek DNS/HTTP evidence for phish domain
tasks.description: Find first/last seen, hosts, URI paths, and response codes.

tasks.title: Confirm execution chain on endpoint
tasks.description: Identify Office -> mshta -> PowerShell chain and any follow-on downloads.

tasks.title: Containment actions
tasks.description: Block domain/IP, isolate host, reset credentials; document evidence supporting each step.

tasks.title: Sigma-first detections
tasks.description: Draft Sigma (and KQL) for mshta + encoded PowerShell patterns.

observables.message: Spoofed sender used by CINDER JACKAL
Observed external IP linked to phish infra

notes.title: CJ Tradecraft Snapshot
notes.content: CINDER JACKAL commonly uses look-alike domains and LOLBAS (mshta + encoded PowerShell) to reduce tool footprint. Focus on parent-child process chain and rapid network pivots.

notes.title: Evidence Standard
notes.content: No evidence → no claims. Every statement must cite a field/value from Elastic or file artifacts.
